article.title: Pulsating low-mass white dwarfs in the frame of new evolutionary sequences: V. Asteroseismology of ELMV white dwarf stars

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The theoretical blue edge for different classes of pulsating white dwarfs.
The evolutionary track of a 0.87 solar mass star.
The location of pre-ELMV white dwarf stars.
The period range of ZZ Ceti stars.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the significance tests shown in Figure 2?
choices: To determine the effective temperature of J1518.
To identify a constant period spacing in the pulsation data of J1518.
To measure the mass of J1518.
To calculate the nonadiabatic growth rate of pulsation modes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the bottom panel of Figure 3 represent?
choices: The Fourier Transform of a Dirac comb function created from the observed periods of J1735.
The Inverse Variance test applied to the period spectrum of J1735.
The Kolmogorov-Smirnov test applied to the period spectrum of J1735.
The luminosity of J1735 as a function of time.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be inferred from Figure 4 regarding the relationship between the average period spacing (ΔΠ) and the stellar mass?
choices: Smaller values of ΔΠ correspond to greater stellar masses.
Larger values of ΔΠ correspond to greater stellar masses.
There is no relationship between ΔΠ and the stellar mass.
ΔΠ is independent of the effective temperature.
The rate of period change for pulsating white dwarf stars.
The luminosity of a white dwarf star as a function of its mass.
The asymptotic period spacing of non-radial g modes.
The mass of a white dwarf star as a function of its effective temperature.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the merit function defined in Formula (2)?
choices: To calculate the nonadiabatic growth rate of pulsation modes.
To determine the effective temperature of a white dwarf star.
To measure the goodness of the match between theoretical and observed pulsation periods.
To calculate the theoretical period spacing of non-radial g modes.
